page.title: 18RURAL HOME LIFE
page.content: The{majority}of our area is{farm {land }and many people live a different daily routine to those in a town. {Farmers}often rise at{5.0 a.m.}to start{milking their cows.}Many have {a cup of tea at 4.0 before evening {milking.}Most of them have a{supper {and go to bed early at 10.0p.m.}Many of them have{large kitchens heated}by an{AGA}range with ovens, fuelled by {wood, coal, oil or gas.}where they sit to watch{television.}Their{wives}help with{haymaking}and grow{vegetables. {Many belong to the Women's Institute {at Cutthorpe or Old Brampton.}Most houses have bathrooms or shower and telephones. Half of the farms are leased on{tenancies}and pass from father to son but{income is fairly low {in most cases. Many children}have their{own duties}from{an early age such as{chicken feeding & ploughing.
